verses.kjv: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.
verses.ct: Like a deer that craves flowing streams, my soul craves you, O God.

verses.kjv: My soul thirsteth for God, for the living God: when shall I come and appear before God?
verses.ct: My soul is thirsty for God — for the living God. When will I finally come and stand in God's presence?

verses.kjv: My tears have been my meat day and night, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy God?
verses.ct: Tears have been my only food day and night, while people constantly ask me, 'Where is your God?'

verses.kjv: When I remember these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had gone with the multitude, I went with them to the house of God, with the voice of joy and praise, with a multitude that kept holyday.
verses.ct: When I think back on this, my heart breaks inside me — because I used to walk with the crowd, leading them into the house of God with shouts of joy and thanksgiving, a whole multitude celebrating the festival.

verses.kjv: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.
verses.ct: Why are you so crushed, my soul? Why are you so restless inside me? Put your hope in God, because I will still praise him for the salvation that comes from his presence.

verses.kjv: O my God, my soul is cast down within me: therefore will I remember thee from the land of Jordan, and of the Hermonites, from the hill Mizar.
verses.ct: My God, my soul is crushed inside me. That is why I will remember you from the land of Jordan, from the peaks of Hermon, and from the hill of Mizar.

verses.kjv: Deep calleth unto deep at the noise of thy waterspouts: all thy waves and thy billows are gone over me.
verses.ct: One deep ocean calls out to another at the roar of your waterfalls — all your waves and surging waters have swept over me.

verses.kjv: Yet the LORD will command his lovingkindness in the day time, and in the night his song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the God of my life.
verses.ct: Yet during the day the LORD sends his faithful love, and at night his song stays with me — a prayer to the God of my life.

verses.kjv: I will say unto God my rock, Why hast thou forgotten me? why go I mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?
verses.ct: I will say to God, my rock, 'Why have you forgotten me? Why must I walk around grieving under the crushing weight of my enemies?'

verses.kjv: As with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach me; while they say daily unto me, Where is thy God?
verses.ct: It cuts like a blade through my bones when my enemies mock me, saying to me every day, 'Where is your God?'

verses.kjv: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
verses.ct: Why are you so crushed, my soul? Why are you so restless inside me? Put your hope in God, because I will still praise him — he is my salvation and my God.
